title: Research timeline visualization libraries and activity aggregation patterns
description: Investigate technical approaches for building a scalable contact activity timeline that can handle high-volume activity data (emails, calls, meetings, notes) and provide real-time updates. Need to evaluate visualization libraries, data aggregation strategies, and caching approaches.

questions.question: Which timeline visualization library provides the best performance and UX for our requirements (React-based, virtualization support, custom event rendering)?
What is the optimal data aggregation strategy for contacts with 1000+ activities (pagination, infinite scroll, or time-based bucketing)?
How should we implement real-time timeline updates when other users add activities (WebSocket, polling, or event-driven architecture)?
What caching strategy will provide the best balance between data freshness and query performance?

objectives: Evaluate at least 3 timeline visualization libraries with POC implementations
Test data loading performance with datasets of 100, 1000, and 10000 activities
Define technical architecture for activity aggregation and caching
Document recommended approach with trade-offs analysis
Identify potential risks and mitigation strategies
